mdRecord.dcterms:title: Letter: John S. Wright, Chicago, to John Augustine Washington III, Mount Vernon, 1855 September 23
mdRecord.dcterms:creator: Wright, John S., 1815-1874
mdRecord.dcterms:description: Letter from prominent Chicago machinery producer J. S. Wright to John Augustine with condolences on the death of his mother, Jane C. Washington. He writes that his mother and John Augustine's were alike: "Both were eminently kind. Religion made both cheerful, animated, companionable... we have known & tried a Mother's love." Autograph letter signed, 8 pages.
